page.title: 11Living in Rural Essex.1.
page.content: {Farming. { }The area is mainly used for arable farming, usual crops being cereals with some sugar beet, some experimental crops are grown in the area including lupins and borage. Farmers do crop very intensively but are fairly conservation minded leaving a reasonable number of hedges and trees, and also small ponds. Many trees have been planted over the last few years, Essex have had a policy of encouraging the planting of native trees. There are very few animals on the farm with no intensive animal husbandry. There is one market garden growing a wide variety of vegetables which are sold locally. No computer run farms in this block.
